poem:
**The Cycle**

Within the drug's embrace,  
we shed the weight of earth,  
hoping to escape gravity's  
inevitable pull. Yet, once free,  
the body whispers old truths,  
tugging us back to familiar soil.  
In this ceaseless dance,  
we find ourselves adrift,  
returning to the hushed embrace  
of what was never truly lost.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
